    RecordSource ="SELECT Schools.SCH_CODE, Schools.P_PID AS PID, Schools.SCHOOL, Schools.ADDR, Sch"
        "ools.CITY, Schools.STATE, Schools.ZIP, Schools.PHONE, Schools.SR_Forms, Schools."
        "JR_Forms, Schools.Temp, Persons.TP, Persons.Temp AS P_Temp, Persons.LAST_CHG, Pe"
        "rsons.FNAME, Persons.LNAME FROM Persons RIGHT JOIN Schools ON Persons.PID=School"
        "s.P_PID ORDER BY Schools.SCH_CODE; "

                            LayoutCachedWidth =1320
                            LayoutCachedHeight =3420
                        End
                    End
                End
                Begin TextBox
                    OverlapFlags =85
                    Left =4320
                    Top =3180
                    Width =360
                    TabIndex =5
                    Name ="STATE"
                    ControlSource ="STATE"
                    OnExit ="[Event Procedure]"
                    ControlTipText ="School State"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0x0c49d0ef5647a0439d50cc4b55bc0470
                    End

                    LayoutCachedLeft =4320
                    LayoutCachedTop =3180
                    LayoutCachedWidth =4680
                    LayoutCachedHeight =3420
                    Begin
                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =85
                            Left =3660
                            Top =3180
                            Width =600
                            Height =240
                            Name ="Label9"
                            Caption ="State:"
                            ControlTipText ="School State"

                                0x090473b27a9f824f88f9631725a26f84
                            End
                            LayoutCachedLeft =3660
                            LayoutCachedTop =3180
                            LayoutCachedWidth =4260
                            LayoutCachedHeight =3420
                        End
                    End
                End
                Begin TextBox
                    OverlapFlags =85
                    Left =5160
                    Top =3180
                    Width =1380
                    TabIndex =6

                    ControlSource ="ZIP"
                    StatusBarText ="School Zip                         Old SCHMAST  ZIP1"
                    ControlTipText ="School ZIP"
                    GUID = Begin
                        0xf69637e31e429242939934841b540c09
                    End

                    LayoutCachedLeft =5160
                    LayoutCachedTop =3180
                    LayoutCachedWidth =6540
                    LayoutCachedHeight =3420
                    Begin
                        Begin Label
                            OverlapFlags =85

                    LayoutCachedHeight =300

        End
    End
End
CodeBehindForm
Attribute VB_GlobalNameSpace = False
Attribute VB_Creatable = True
Attribute VB_PredeclaredId = True
Attribute VB_Exposed = False
'    SciFairMaster.mdb  (All class objects and modules)
'
'    Copyright (C) 2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013,
'                  2014  Dennis e.Spanogle
'
'    This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
'    it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
'    the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
'    (at your option) any later version.
'
'    This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
'    but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
'    MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
'    GNU General Public License for more details.
'
'    You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
'    along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
'* Choose The Form Properties and build the Data : DataSource SQL (click on ..)
'* Save the Form with a NEW NAME!  Use Menu File:SaveAs
'* Replace all occurances of 'SCH_CODE'  with the name
'   of the indexed key. (i.e. replace SCH_CODE with EXN or JUN or ..)
'   uncomment any lines changed you want to use
'* Place the First Field on the form (A combo box/Field to receive first focus)
'*  This will typically be the Indexed Key or a person type field (cbPerson)
'   If a cbPerson combo box not added, Delete the routines re 'cbPerson'
'   Set The Tab order to 0 for this field
'* Search for and fix all 'Edit This' locations not yet changed
'* Redo the SQL statements for cbFindNum/cbFindName Properties, Data Row Source
'   Set the First Field for both to the Indexed Key field
Option Compare Database
Option Explicit
Private HoldCRCState As Boolean ' current state of 'Confirm Record Change' option
Private ctlPrevFocus As Control 'Used to reset focus after button push
Private criteria As String      'Query SQL Strings
Private msg As String           'Message Box Prompts
Private DeletePID As Long          'PID of priciple when delete school
Private tLNAME As String
Private tFNAME As String
Private personsRS As Recordset
Private OldPID As Long          ' Hold PID when priciple changed so can delete old
Private OldSch As Long
Private Title As String         'Title of this form
Private DidDelete As Boolean    'Deleted a Record from Form recordset
Private DidPersonAdd As Boolean 'Added a Person using cbPerson needing CrLf
Private DidAdd As Boolean       'A New Record has been added to Form Recordset
Private TouchedUndo As Boolean  'The Undo Button was touched by mouse
Private DeleteLast As Boolean   'The Delete button deleted the last record
                                'Used to avoid moving to add new record
Private InAdd As Boolean        'In Add new record mode
Private DoCrLf As Boolean       'May be used by timer to exit a combo box
Private TSch_Code As Long ' hold for log delete
Private tSCHOOL As String

Private Sub cbFindName_AfterUpdate()
  On Error GoTo SubError
  If (IsNull(cbFindName)) Then
     'MsgBox "Nothing Selected!"
     'cbFindStudent.SetFocus
     Exit Sub
  End If
  'Nextline (vs setrs,me.bookmark=rs.bookmark) allows updates in
  ' Form.BeforeUpdate
  ' Replace 'First' 'Name' next line. Do not replace in 2nd line Find Next
  Me.Recordset.FindFirst "SCH_CODE = " & Str(Me![cbFindName]) ' Edit This?
  Me.cbFindName = Null ' No Edits or replacement on this line
  Me.SCHOOL.SetFocus ' Replace / Edit this
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindNum_AfterUpdate()
   ' Find the record that matches the control.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If (IsNull(cbFindNum)) Then
       'MsgBox "Nothing Selected!"
       'cbFindNum.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
   End If
  'Nextline (vs setrs,me.bookmark=rs.bookmark) allows updates in
  '  Form.BeforeUpdate
  Me.Recordset.FindFirst "SCH_CODE = " & Str(Me![cbFindNum]) 'Edit This?
  Me.cbFindNum = Null
  Me.SCHOOL.SetFocus ' Replace / Edit this
Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub RequeryCBs()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   If DidDelete = True Then
     Me.cbFindNum.Requery
     ' Do not replace string name in this or next line - Find Next
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidDelete = False
   End If
   If DidAdd = True Then
     Me.cbFindNum.Requery
     ' Do not replace string name in this or next line - Find Next
     Me.cbFindName.Requery
     DidAdd = False
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindNum_Enter()
   Call RequeryCBs
End Sub
Private Sub cbFindName_Enter()
   Call RequeryCBs
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
   ' IMPORTANT: If leave cbperson using timer routine after
   ' notinlist sets Response = acDataErrContinue then this is NOT CALLED
   'Edit This (Delete if no cbPersons
   ' User selected a different Person or new person for a New record
   ' The person selected could already be referenced in another record.
   ' If I do not want duplicates, then do the following
   ' a good thing so I will not allow it.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Find the record that matches the new PID
   Dim rs As Object
   Set rs = Me.Recordset.Clone
   rs.FindFirst "[PID] = " & cbPerson.Value 'Edit this PID of selected person
   If rs.NoMatch Then
      ' Find just continue
   Else
      ' Edit this (next line)
      msg = "Already a Principal for another School!" & vbCrLf & _
             " Hint: Press [Esc] key after selecting [NO] " & vbCrLf & _
             "Want To Keep This Person?"
       If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
         Cancel = True
         Exit Sub
       End If
   End If
   ' Save info to Remove "PR" from old person (optional) or delete person or...
   ' see Form.AfterUpdate
   If cbPerson.OldValue <> cbPerson.Value Then
      OldPID = cbPerson.OldValue
      OldSch = SCH_CODE
   Else
      OldPID = 0
   End If
   
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   ' Do this code for new adds for Job type Tables (judges, students etc)
   ' If the Person is not the first entry (required)
   ' this may not be needed.
   ' Use this area to set up other fields after the person entry
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Edit This
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub Form_AfterUpdate()
  On Error GoTo SubError
  If OldPID > 0 Then   ' set in cbperson.BeforeUpdate -  Option to delete Previous person
   Call DeleteFixPerson(OldPID, "PR", True, "School " & Me.SCH_CODE & " Principal")
   ' True above means just changed the principal
  End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  OldPID = 0
  'personsRS.Close
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Timer()
  ' Edit this  - delete this if cbPerson is not used
  ' This moves to the next object in the case a persons was added to cbPerson
  ' that was not orgionally typed or in case the orgional string had a ';'
  ' SEE cbPerson_NotInList
  On Error GoTo SubError
  DidPersonAdd = False
  Me.TimerInterval = 0
  SendKeys "{TAB}"  '
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub cbPerson_NotInList(newdata As String, Response As Integer)
   ' If the person is not in the Persons Table then we need to add a record
   ' To the persons table.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Edit This  (next Line   name of forms table and TP )
   If Person_NotInList(Me, "Schools", "PR", newdata, Response, _
            DidPersonAdd) = True Then
     If Response = acDataErrAdded Then ' Person added just as typed
         ' Focus will move to next object, no more work
     Else  ' Added diferent person (List selection) or had ';' in string
         ' Focus remains with cbPerson with new person selected.
         ' try to move on to next object with timer...
         ' If do all this then cbPerson_Before/AfterUpdate not called
         Me.TimerInterval = 50  ' wait 50 milliseconds.  Should be
         ' enough for slower PCs (133 Mhz) since 1 Ms works for 833Mhz PC
     End If
   Else   ' failed to work or user canceled add..
     ' Origionally typed string still in combo box, user can edit or whatever!
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub SCH_CODE_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   lblSCH_CODE.Caption = " "
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub TP_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Dim tpstr As String
   tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
   Call setFieldTP(tpstr, "PR")
   Me.TP = tpstr
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub STATE_Exit(Cancel As Integer)
    On Error GoTo SubError
    If IsNull(Me.[STATE]) Then Exit Sub ' no need to check
    If StrComp(Me.[STATE], UCase(Me.[STATE]), 0) <> 0 Then ' Binary compare
        Me.[STATE] = UCase(Me.[STATE])   ' do only if not already ucase
    End If
    Exit Sub
SubError:
    MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub Form_Current()  'Here for each time a new record is selected
   On Error GoTo SubError
   TouchedUndo = False
   OldPID = 0
   If Me.NewRecord Then ' Or IsNull(Me.PROTOID) Then
      'Me.Fieldnam.Locked = False ' Allow a field to be changed. Edit This
      Me.tbRecord = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
      Me.tbNumRec = 1 + Me.Recordset.RecordCount
      DidAdd = True
      InAdd = True
      Me.cbFindNum.Requery
      If DeleteLast = False Then ' skip if went to add due to delete last
       Dim scnum As Integer
       Dim ii As Integer
       For scnum = 1 To 999
        For ii = 0 To Me.cbFindNum.ListCount - 1  ' check all numbers in query
          If Val(Me.cbFindNum.Column(0, ii)) = scnum Then
            Exit For ' SCH_CODE used, so do nothing
          End If
        Next ii
        If ii = Me.cbFindNum.ListCount Then 'this trueif did not find SCH_CODE
          ' did not find, can use this RXN
          Me.SCH_CODE = scnum ' ----- Fill in the RXN field --------------------
          'Me.lblSCH_CODE.Caption = " <--- First Available SCH_CODE"
          lblSCH_CODE.Caption = "<-- First Available SCH_CODE "
          Exit For
        End If
       Next scnum
       If scnum = 1000 Then  ' This may occur
        msg = "No available SCH_CODE Numbers 1 to 999" & vbCrLf & _
              "You Must Delete a Record!"
        MsgBox msg, vbOKOnly, Title
       End If
      End If  ' if delete last = false
   Else
      Call RequeryCBs ' If
      lblSCH_CODE.Caption = " "
      DeleteLast = False
      InAdd = False
      Me.tbNumRec = Me.Recordset.RecordCount
      Me.tbRecord = Me.CurrentRecord
      'Me.Fieldnam.Locked = False ' CHANGE this to TRUE to lock. Edit This
   End If
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub SCH_CODE_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer) ' Replace this  Edit This
  'You may not want users to change the key value!
  ' Use this area to warn of changes
  On Error GoTo SubError
  '  Warn if about to change
  If Not IsNull(Me.SCH_CODE) And TouchedUndo = False _
        And InAdd = False Then ' Replace /Edit This
    ' Replace or Edit This  (next line)
    msg = "You are about to change the Key Value SCH_CODE!" & vbCrLf & _
          "Although OK, Be sure you want to do this!" & vbCrLf & _
          "Tables with references to this School will be updated if" & vbCrLf & _
          "Referential Integrity & Cascade Update are both set." & vbCrLf & _
          " (Hint: Press [Esc] key after selecting [NO]) " & vbCrLf & _
          "CHANGE SCH_CODE? "
    If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
       Cancel = True
       Exit Sub
    End If
  End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeUpdate(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  ' Edit This   Do any checks here.  For Example
  ' added rev 5.4.0
  If Me.SCH_CODE > 996 Then
    If MsgBox("Entries 997,998 and 999 are application use only!" & vbCrLf & _
            "They should not be Edited! Continue Anyway?" & vbCrLf & vbCrLf & _
            "Click NO, then OK, Then press the Esc key on the keyboard. (Recommended)" & vbCrLf & _
            "Click Yes only if you have read and understand the instructions!", _
            vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, "Edit Not Recomended!") = vbNo Then
       Cancel = True
       Exit Sub
    End If
  End If
  If Me.SCH_CODE > 999 Or Me.SCH_CODE < 1 Or IsNull(Me.SCH_CODE) Then
      MsgBox "SCH_CODE Must be between 1 and 999!", , Title
      Cancel = True
  End If
  ' Edit This  Do any updates for example
  Dim tpstr As String
  If Not IsNull(Me.PID) Then   ' Do Not create a person record if no PID
    tpstr = IIf(IsNull(Me.TP), "", Me.TP)
    Call setFieldTP(tpstr, "PR")         ' Edit this
    Me.TP = tpstr
    Me.LAST_CHG = Format(Now, "mm/dd/yy")
  End If
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Delete(Cancel As Integer)
   ' This plus Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm work to ALWAYS show a delete message
   ' Even if user has turned off the warning messages.
   On Error GoTo SubError
   msg = "DELETE RECORD?"
   If MsgBox(msg, vbYesNo + vbDefaultButton2, Title) = vbNo Then
      Cancel = True
      Exit Sub
   End If
   DidDelete = True   ' Indicate did a delete of the record
   TSch_Code = Me.SCH_CODE
   tSCHOOL = IIf(IsNull(Me.SCHOOL), "no name", Me.SCHOOL)
   
   DeletePID = IIf(IsNull(Me.cbPerson.Value), 0, Me.cbPerson.Value)
   
   tLNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me!LNAME), "", Me!LNAME)
   tFNAME = IIf(IsNull(Me!FNAME), "", Me!FNAME)
   
   
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_BeforeDelConfirm(Cancel As Integer, Response As Integer)
   ' This suppresses the system confirmation message, I give message in
   ' Sub Form_Delete (
   On Error GoTo SubError
   Response = acDataErrContinue
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_AfterDelConfirm(STATUS As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  ' Use this to delete other related records (i.e. Persons) BUT,
  ' You must do :me.Application.SetOption "Confirm RecordChanges",True
  '   Or this Routine is NEVER CALLED!
  Call ScifairLog("Del School SCH_CODE: ", TSch_Code, " " & tSCHOOL)
  Call DeleteFixPerson(DeletePID, "PR")
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub

Private Sub Form_Dirty(Cancel As Integer)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  ' Edit This  You can use this area to update fields that change anytime
  ' and edit is done to the record - i.e. LastUpdate fields
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Load()
  On Error GoTo SubError
  ' Add any Code Required prior to Form showing on Screen Edit This
  HoldCRCState = Me.Application.GetOption("Confirm Record Changes")
  Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", True
  Exit Sub
SubError:
  MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Open(Cancel As Integer)
  ' Open any Tables or SQL queries here
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Title = "NewForm Edit"     'Edit This
  DidDelete = False
  Me.Rev.Caption = RevisionDate
  DidAdd = False
  DoCrLf = False
  DeletePID = 0
  ' The next statements give a type mismatch error unless or until
  ' I fixed the priority of references in the Visual Basic Tools option.
  ' Sequence must be:
  ' Visual Basic for Applications
  ' Microsoft Access 9.0 Library
  ' Microsoft Office 9.0 Library
  ' OLE Automation
  ' Microsoft DAO 3.6 Obj Lib
  ' Microsoft Visual Basic of Application Extensibility 5.3
  '  Others as needed
  ' Open any Needed Recordsets Edit This
  'criteria = "SELECT ..."
  'Set theRS = CurrentDb().OpenRecordset(criteria, dbOpenDynaset)
  Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub Form_Close()
   On Error GoTo SubError
   ' Close Any Needed Recordsets  Edit This
   'theRS.Close
   Me.Application.SetOption "Confirm Record Changes", HoldCRCState
   Exit Sub
SubError:
   MsgBox Err.Description
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, _
                              x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnFirst_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnFirst_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acFirst
    On Error Resume Next
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnFirst_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnFirst_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnFirst_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, _
                                                  x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnPrev_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnPrev_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
    On Error Resume Next
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnPrev_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnPrev_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnPrev_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, _
x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnNext_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnNext_Click
    If Me.CurrentRecord = Me.Recordset.RecordCount Then
       MsgBox "End of Data!"
       ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
       Exit Sub
    End If
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNext
    On Error Resume Next
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnNext_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnNext_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnNext_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, _
                                            x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnLast_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnLast_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acLast
    On Error Resume Next
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnLast_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnLast_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnLast_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnAdd_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnAdd_Click
    DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acNewRec
    On Error Resume Next
    ' Set Focus on Desired First Entry Box here Edit This
    Me.SCH_CODE.SetFocus
Exit_btnAdd_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnAdd_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnAdd_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, _
                                    x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnDelete_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
      DeleteLast = False
      If Me.Recordset.RecordCount = Me.CurrentRecord Then  'last record
        DeleteLast = True
      End If
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 8, , acMenuVer70  'Select Record
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, 6, , acMenuVer70  'Delete
      If DeleteLast = True Then ' Bill Gates goes to add new record-Not Desired
        'On Error Resume Next '
        'DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, acUndo, , acMenuVer70
        'On Error GoTo Err_btnDelete_Click
        DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
        DeleteLast = False
      End If
      On Error Resume Next ' Skip all messages re not able to focus
      ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
Exit_btnDelete_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnDelete_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnDelete_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_MouseDown(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
  On Error GoTo SubError
  Set ctlPrevFocus = Screen.PreviousControl
  Exit Sub
SubError:
 ' MsgBox Err.Description 'Normally No Message is needed
End Sub
Private Sub btnSave_Click()
    ' Save the Indexed value so can move to it after save
    Dim SvSCH_CODE As Long   ' Replace this else Edit This
    On Error GoTo Err_btnSave_Click
    ' Check that at least the minimum is done. NOTE: any code put here will not
    ' be executed if the user does menu save Record, Shift Enter or moves to
    ' Another record - so... This is just to 'Pre-Warn'
    If IsNull(Me.SCH_CODE) Then ' Replace This else Edit This
      MsgBox "Must Enter SCH_CODE! (or Undo)", vbOKOnly, Title 'Rpl/ Edit This
      On Error Resume Next
      ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
      Exit Sub
    Else
      SvSCH_CODE = Me.SCH_CODE  ' Replace both Else Edit This
    End If
    If InAdd Then  ' Only save if in add mode
      DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, acSaveRecord, , acMenuVer70
    End If
    ' The next command does a Remove Filter Sort which in effect requeries
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acRecordsMenu, 3, , acMenuVer70 'RemFiltSort
    On Error Resume Next
    ctlPrevFocus.SetFocus
    Me.Recordset.FindFirst "SCH_CODE = " & SvSCH_CODE  'Replace Both /Edit This
Exit_btnSave_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnSave_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnSave_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnUndo_Click()
On Error GoTo Err_btnUndo_Click
   If IsNull(Me.SCH_CODE) And IsNull(Me.cbPerson) Then
     DoCmd.GoToRecord , , acPrevious
     Exit Sub
   End If
    DoCmd.DoMenuItem acFormBar, acEditMenu, acUndo, , acMenuVer70
Exit_btnUndo_Click:
    Exit Sub
Err_btnUndo_Click:
    MsgBox Err.Description
    Resume Exit_btnUndo_Click
End Sub
Private Sub btnUndo_MouseMove(Button As Integer, Shift As Integer, x As Single, Y As Single)
   TouchedUndo = True
End Sub
